column4: i get umount: /mnt/c: device is busy when i try and umount - how do i see what is using this mounted drive?
lsof | grep /mnt/c might help
hm, if you have a terminal with path /mnt/c or nautilus pointing to it the device willl not umount
and they don't show in lsof that way
the error comes up twice, not just once which is strange
it always does
it cant be xchat?
not unless you pointed it to /mnt/c at some point
you don't have any terminal open?
do cd / there
and no nautilus windows open?
same thing, and no nautilus open
what other programs are you running besides xchat?
nothing
sudo umount -f /mnt/c
very strange
it's a clean ubuntu install?
not clean been running for about one month
don't know then, but i gotto go, sorry
it shoudl be done automagically
did not on mine, but then i used blackdown i think
have you tried gnomebaker?
